pages.context: Page A000, titled 'Egress Plan', details accessibility requirements and the egress plan for a restaurant. It includes accessibility notes specifying clearances, mounting heights, and slopes, along with a legend defining symbols for accessible routes and exit signs. The egress floor plan shows the restaurant layout with egress paths, exit sign locations, and identifies modified and new areas such as the drive-thru, kitchen, catering area, and office.

identifiers.content: Reference to another sheet for proposed OMD canopy details

identifiers.ref: 1. ALL CROSS SLOPES THAT ARE A PORTION OF THE ACCESSIBLE ROUTE SHALL BE A MAXIMUM OF 2%
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying maximum allowable cross slope for accessible paths.

identifiers.ref: 2. IF UMBRELLAS OR AWNINGS ARE USED ON THE SITE, THE BOTTOM FLAPS SHALL BE A MINIMUM OF 6'-8" ABOVE THE FINISHED GRADE.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying vertical clearance for overhead site elements.

identifiers.ref: 3. ACCESSIBLE TABLES SHALL BE A MINIMUM OF 27" CLEAR KNEE SPACE A.F.F. AND HAVE A CLEAR AREA OF AT LEAST 19" DEEP. TOP OF TABLE SHALL BE 34" A.F.F.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note defining dimensions for accessible dining tables.

identifiers.ref: 4. COAT HOOKS IN THE TOILET STALLS SHALL BE MOUNTED TO THE BACKSIDES OF DOORS AT 48" A.F.F. IN ACCESSIBLE STALLS AND 60" IN STANDARD STALLS.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying mounting heights for coat hooks in restrooms.

identifiers.ref: 5. FLUSH VALVES ON THE TOILETS SHALL ALWAYS BE LOCATED ON THE WIDE SIDE OF THE TOILET STALL. UTILIZE 5 LBS. OF FORCE OR LESS TO OPERATE.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying location and operating force for toilet flush valves.

identifiers.ref: 6. ALL PANIC HARDWARE SHALL BE MOUNTED NO HIGHER THAN 46" A.F.F.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying maximum mounting height for exit device panic hardware.

identifiers.ref: 7. ALL FLOOR DRAINS IN KITCHEN SHALL BE LOCATED OUT OF PATH OF TRAVEL SO THAT THE FLOOR DOES NOT HAVE A SLOPE GREATER THAN 2 % ALONG AN ACCESSIBLE ROUTE.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note coordinating floor drain placement with accessible route slope requirements.

identifiers.ref: 8. ALL THRESHOLDS, FLOOR LEVEL CHANGES, AND FLOOR TRANSITIONS SHALL NOT EXCEED 1/2" IN HEIGHT AND SHALL BE BEVELED WITH A SLOPE NO GREATER THE 1:2.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying maximum height and bevel requirements for floor transitions.

identifiers.ref: 9. ALL LIGHT SWITCHES, VOLUME CONTROLS, AND THERMOSTATS IN PUBLIC AREAS SHALL BE MOUNTED NO HIGHER THAN 48" A.F.F. U.N.O.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note specifying maximum reach height for controls in public spaces.

identifiers.ref: 10. FOR CLARIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS OR QUESTIONS, CALL THE ARCHITECT OF RECORD.
identifiers.content: Accessibility note directing the contractor to the architect for any questions regarding these notes.
Legend definition for the shaded area representing the minimum required width for an accessible path.

Details include storefront profiles, door head and jamb assemblies, exterior door thresholds, and wall base conditions, particularly for kitchen areas, with references to finish schedules and waterproofing requirements.

pages.context: Page 1, titled "A902 Specifications.pdf", contains technical specifications related to LEED requirements, including material specifications for recycled content, regional materials, certified wood, and low-emitting materials. It also covers construction waste management, including waste diversion goals, definitions, submittal requirements, and execution procedures for salvaging, recycling, and disposing of construction waste.

identifiers.content: LEED Requirements specification, covering definitions, submittals, recycled content, regional materials, certified wood, and low-emitting materials with VOC limits for adhesives and sealants.
LEED Credit MR 4, specifying requirements for recycled content of materials, mandating a minimum of 10 percent recycled content by cost.
LEED Credit MR 5, specifying requirements for regional materials, mandating a minimum of 10 percent of building materials (by cost) to be regional materials.
LEED Credit MR 7, specifying requirements for certified wood, mandating a minimum of 50 percent (by cost) of wood-based materials to be FSC-certified.
LEED Credit EQ 4, specifying requirements for low-emitting materials, including VOC content limits for adhesives, sealants, paints, and coatings.
LEED Construction Waste Management specification, detailing administrative and procedural requirements for salvaging, recycling, and disposing of construction waste.

pages.context: This is an architectural site plan for a Chick-fil-A, showing existing and proposed building footprints, drive-thru lanes, parking layouts, and site access. Keynotes mark areas for drive-thru lanes and parking, while callouts reference details for canopies (OMD, patio, F2F) and the refuse enclosure on other sheets. The plan also includes dimensions for the proposed trash enclosure and notes to refer to the civil site plan.

pages.context: This architectural plan, "AS1.1 F2F Canopy Plan.pdf", details the layout and specifications for a double-lane drive-thru canopy, including structural columns, lighting (CRUS SC LED LW 30 UE WHT), heaters (Schwank 2352 N/L Outdoor), fans (TPI CORP - 18CACOUTE), and drainage. It includes an exterior finishes schedule (PTC-1, PTC-2) and assigns canopy design responsibility to Lane Supply, Inc.

pages.context: This architectural sheet (AS3.1) details the patio canopy design, including plan and elevation views, and railing embedment details. It specifies dimensions, materials (PTC-1, PTC-2), and installation requirements for the canopy structure, railing system, and post embedments, including weep hole requirements and sealant specifications. The sheet also references other drawings (A101, A301) and details (5/AS3.1, 7/AS3.1) for related components.

pages.context: This page (AS4.1) details the refuse enclosure with plan and elevation views. It specifies materials like painted split face CMU, prefinished metal coping (dark bronze, PT-113), and 16 GA form deck gates, along with dimensions and vertical datums for grade, slab, and top of wall. The plan includes specifications for a post hydrant (Woodford Model Y2), roof ventilator, and coordination notes for structural, civil, and electrical trades.
